1.text: Followers of me become ye, as I also am of Christ.

2.text: And I praise you, brethren, that in all things ye remember me, and according as I did deliver to you, the deliverances ye keep,

3.text: and I wish you to know that of every man the head is the Christ, and the head of a woman is the husband, and the head of Christ is God.

4.text: Every man praying or prophesying, having the head covered, doth dishonour his head,

5.text: and every woman praying or prophesying with the head uncovered, doth dishonour her own head, for it is one and the same thing with her being shaven,

6.text: for if a woman is not covered—then let her be shorn, and if it is a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven—let her be covered;

7.text: for a man, indeed, ought not to cover the head, being the image and glory of God, and a woman is the glory of a man,

8.text: for a man is not of a woman, but a woman is of a man,

9.text: for a man also was not created because of the woman, but a woman because of the man;

10.text: because of this the woman ought to have a token of authority upon the head, because of the messengers;

11.text: but neither is a man apart from a woman, nor a woman apart from a man, in the Lord,

12.text: for as the woman is of the man, so also the man is through the woman, and the all things are of God.

13.text: In your own selves judge ye; is it seemly for a woman uncovered to pray to God?

14.text: doth not even nature itself teach you, that if a man indeed have long hair, a dishonour it is to him?

15.text: and a woman, if she have long hair, a glory it is to her, because the hair instead of a covering hath been given to her;

16.text: and if any one doth think to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the assemblies of God.

17.text: And this declaring, I give no praise, because not for the better, but for the worse ye come together;

18.text: for first, indeed, ye coming together in an assembly, I hear of divisions being among you, and partly I believe it,

19.text: for it behoveth sects also to be among you, that those approved may become manifest among you;

20.text: ye, then, coming together at the same place—it is not to eat the Lord’s supper;

21.text: for each his own supper doth take before in the eating, and one is hungry, and another is drunk;

22.text: why, have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? or the assembly of God do ye despise, and shame those not having? what may I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I do not praise!

23.text: For I—I received from the Lord that which also I did deliver to you, that the Lord Jesus in the night in which he was delivered up, took bread,

24.text: and having given thanks, he brake, and said, ‘Take ye, eat ye, this is my body, that for you is being broken; this do ye—to the remembrance of me.’

25.text: In like manner also the cup after the supping, saying, ‘This cup is the new covenant in my blood; this do ye, as often as ye may drink it—to the remembrance of me;’

26.text: for as often as ye may eat this bread, and this cup may drink, the death of the Lord ye do shew forth—till he may come;

27.text: so that whoever may eat this bread or may drink the cup of the Lord unworthily, guilty he shall be of the body and blood of the Lord:

28.text: and let a man be proving himself, and so of the bread let him eat, and of the cup let him drink;

29.text: for he who is eating and drinking unworthily, judgment to himself he doth eat and drink—not discerning the body of the Lord.

30.text: Because of this, among you many are weak and sickly, and sleep do many;

31.text: for if ourselves we were discerning, we would not be being judged,

32.text: and being judged by the Lord, we are chastened, that with the world we may not be condemned;

33.text: so then, my brethren, coming together to eat, for one another wait ye;

34.text: and if any one is hungry, at home let him eat, that to judgment ye may not come together; and the rest, whenever I may come, I shall arrange.
